channel.title: [317 PI] Drinking potions
channel.description:
What I have so far is: [code]c.sendMessage("You drink the super attack potion."); c.sendMessage("You have 3 doses of your potion left.");[/code]
But those two messages land at the same time. How do I make it so that there is a small delay between those two messages?
Help is appreciated!

item.title: [317 PI] Drinking potions
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“DaMatt17, post:9, topic:428871”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=531568.msg3884173#msg3884173 date=1326307121]
You don’t really need to tell the user how many doses they have left via chatbox. Replacing the item in the inventory will already tell them.
[/quote]

I added the doses because I thought it would be more realistic…[/quote]

As far as I know, RS doesn’t send a message to the player saying how many doses there are. The amount is inferred from the item. If you have an Attack potion (4), and use it once, it will be replaced with an Attack potion (3), and so on. The amount of doses is in the name, and so whenever the player hovers over the item, not only will they see the difference in model, but also the action text will display the item name.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Drinking potions
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:5, topic:428871”] int dose = 0; final String name = c.getItems().getItemName(itemId); final String[] msg = { "You drink some of your " + name, "You now have " + dose + " of your potion left." }; c.sendMessage(msg[0]);

You can finish it, cbf.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:
@DaMatt17 wrote:

zyle1992:

You don’t really need to tell the user how many doses they have left via chatbox. Replacing the item in the inventory will already tell them.

I added the doses because I thought it would be more realistic…

item.title: [317 PI] Drinking potions
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:7, topic:428871”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=531568.msg3884191#msg3884191 date=1326309216]

EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { //add shit here c.stop(); } }, ENTER MS HERE);

ENTER MS HERE is where you enter the time, based of ms i think. Use cycle event manager if u want to do it using cycles. (every 600ms)
[/quote]

Provided he’s using Grahams.[/quote]

All PI’s use this by default, judging by the question, and how simple this was, he probably didn’t remove this for a better one…

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Drinking potions
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

	int dose = 0;
	final String name = c.getItems().getItemName(itemId);
	final String[] msg = { 
	    "You drink some of your " + name, "You now have " + dose + " of your potion left."
	};
	c.sendMessage(msg[0]);

You can finish it, cbf.
